body.p:
His Excellency -- Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Your petitioner Richard T Garnett says he is County Judge of Adair County --

That in said County on the day of October 1863 James Edwards an aged law abiding good citizen of Adair County was in said county most brutally murdered by John Mullins, Micajah Richards, and Bal Daniels (alias Bal Jones)

Your petitioner therefore prays that Your Excellency will offer a suitable reward for the apprehension & delivery of the said murderers to the proper officers of Adair County, No judicial examination has been had of the matter, the murderers having fled from justice --
R. T. Garnett P J A C C
John Mullins is a low heavy set man with a scar on one of his cheeks, caused apparently by a boil salivation, or gun shot wound --
Micajah Richards is a dark skinned, black eyed man, slender and about 5 feet 7 or 8 inches high --

Bal Daniel (alias Bal Jones) is a large light haired, light eyed ruffian looking man about 5 feet 11 or 6 feet high & weighs 170 or 180 pounds, All profess to be Tennessee refugees from the rebel conscription or rebel deserters
